I apologize for the mistake in my previous response. Here's my new attempt based on your revised scenario:

Gary: Welcome back to Citi Field, folks, where we have a nail-biter of a Game 7 between the Mets and the Seattle Mariners. The score is tied at 2-2 in the top of the ninth inning, and the Mariners have loaded the bases with just one out.

Keith: And Gary, we have a new second baseman for the Mets, who is showing incredible gumption in this pressure-packed situation. His name is Carnage, and he's making his World Series debut. Can he handle the heat?

Ron: Well, he's got a tough task ahead of him, Keith. The Mariners have their cleanup hitter, Kyle Seager, at the plate, and he's one of the most dangerous hitters in the game.

Gary: And here comes Jacob deGrom with the first pitch. It's a slider, and Seager swings and misses!

Keith: DeGrom is dealing tonight, folks. He's got his A-game going, and the Mariners are struggling to catch up.

Ron: Okay, here comes the next pitch, and it's a fastball, high and tight. Seager lays off this one, and it's ball one.

Gary: And now the count is even at 1-1. Carnage is playing deep at second base, trying to cover as much ground as possible.

Keith: He's got to be on his toes here, Gary. A ground ball to second could end the inning, but a fly ball to the outfield could score the go-ahead run.

Ron: And Seager swings at the next pitch! It's a line drive to the right side of the infield, and Carnage makes a diving catch!

Gary: What a play by Carnage! He's up quickly and throws to Lindor at second base to double off the runner! It's a double play, and the Mets are out of the inning!

Keith: Unbelievable! Carnage has just saved the game for the Mets with an incredible diving catch and a heads-up double play. He's showing incredible poise and confidence out there.

Ron: And just look at the replay, folks. Carnage dives to his right and snags the ball out of mid-air. And then he pops up and makes a strong throw to second base to get the force out. That's a game-changer right there.

Gary: And now the Mets are coming up to bat in the bottom of the ninth inning, with a chance to win the World Series. This is what baseball is all about, folks.
